oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Error-detecting codes and fault-containing self-stabilization
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: HERMAN, T
PEMMARAJU, S
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: systems
fault tolerance
self-stabilization
fault containment
error-detecting codes
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Self-stabilizing algorithms recover from all cases of transient failure, but the mechanism of self-stabilization may be costly for mild cases of transient failure. Error-detecting codes can be used to identify, with high probability, transient faults in data. This note investigates how error-detecting codes can enhance self-stabilization to deal efficiently with the common case of single-process transient faults. The main results are characterizations of self-stabilizing algorithms that can use error-detecting codes to recover from single-process transient faults in a single step. (C) 2000 .
